intro: Malvastrum bicuspidatum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture and are arranged alternately along the stem. This species is often found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
